snippet: As Europe’s leaders bickered over policy, thousands of migrants were stuck in Budapest, while trains between France and Britain were disrupted.
abstract: Number of migrants camped outside Keleti train station in Budapest continues to grow, forming squalid community on city streets, as Hungarian authorities continue to bar migrants from entering station

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Rick Lyman reported from Budapest, and Dan Bilefsky from London. Reporting was contributed by Anemona Hartocollis and Palko Karasz from Budapest, Steven Erlanger from London, Alison Smale from Vienna, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.

lead_paragraph: As Europe’s leaders bickered over policy, thousands of migrants were stuck in Budapest, while trains between France and Britain were disrupted.

headline.main: Squalid Migrant City Rises in Budapest as Europe Seeks Solutions
headline.print_headline: Squalid Migrant City Rises in Budapest as Europe Seeks Solutions

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
